required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Dental Pulp Tissue as an Autogenous Graft for Ridge Augmentation
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Dental Pulp Tissue as an Autogenous Graft for Ridge Augmentation

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine and compare the effects of autogenous dental pulp tissue on bone formation in the extraction sockets as compared to commonly used particulate bone graft. The effects on bone formation will be examined using a wide variety of assays.

primary_outcome.measure: Bone fill as assessed by radiograph
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after placement of bone graft

primary_outcome.measure: Bone fill as assessed by radiograph
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after placement of bone graft

primary_outcome.measure: Bone fill as assessed by radiograph
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Extent of mineralization as assessed by von Kossa staining
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Extent of mineralization as assessed by Xylenol Orange staining
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker Bsp assessed by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker BSP assessed by immunostaining using anti-BSP antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker Bglap assessed by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker BGLAP assessed by immunostaining using anti-BGLAP antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker Dmp1 assessed by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker DMP1 assessed by immunostaining using anti-DMP1 antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker Col1a1 assessed by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of osteoblastic marker Sost assessed by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after placement of bone graft

arm_group.arm_group_label: Particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue
arm_group.description: Dental pulp will be isolated from teeth extracted for non-periodontal reasons chairside. The isolated dental pulp will be mixed with hydrated particulate bone graft, and the mixture will be placed in the debrided extraction socket. The socket will be covered by a resorbable collagen membrane and sutured.
Hydrated particulate bone graft will be placed in the debrided extraction socket. The socket will be covered by a resorbable collagen membrane and sutured.

intervention.description: Creos allo.gain allogenic bone particulate mineralized cortical bone will be hydrated and placed in the extraction socket.
intervention.arm_group_label: Particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue

intervention.description: Dental pulp will be isolated from teeth extracted for non-periodontal reasons chairside, mixed with hydrated particulate bone graft, and then placed in the extraction socket.
intervention.arm_group_label: Particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue

intervention.description: After placement of particulate bone graft or particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue, socket will be covered by a resorbable collagen membrane and sutured.
intervention.arm_group_label: Particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue
Particulate bone graft plus autogenous dental pulp tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Classification System ASA 1 (A normal healthy patient) or ASA 2 (A patient with mild systemic disease)
- never smoker
- patients with planned tooth extraction
- intact extraction sockets
- no medication or antibiotics intake for at least 6 months prior to the procedure
- patients who gave their consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- vulnerable subjects (children, pregnant and lactating women, patients with learning disabilities, and prisoners)
- inability to obtain pulp tissue (for example, due to previous endodontic therapy, obliterated pulp canals)
